title: Irregular medical condition start
vignette: A woman unexpectedly begins experiencing symptoms a few days early.

options.text: She follows recovery protocol from when the symptoms stop.
Ignore early symptoms and follow her usual schedule.

title: Seeing a small stain
vignette: A tiny stain the size of a pinhead appears on her garment.

options.text: Any stain requires medical isolation regardless of amount.
Less than a lentil is disregarded as accidental.

title: Borrowed test kit for checking
vignette: She uses a friend's test kit when hers is lost.

options.text: Borrowing is fine if the kit is clean.
Only her own kit is acceptable for reliability.

title: Partner returns unexpectedly
vignette: Her spouse returns from a trip without notice during her recovery period.

options.text: They must maintain distance until the recovery ends.
Since he surprised her, the recovery can pause for reunion.

title: Medical condition confusion
vignette: She experiences a brief discharge but is unsure if it was serious.

options.text: Treat it as a medical condition and observe isolation protocol.
If uncertain, assume it was not and continue normally.

title: Delayed treatment
vignette: After completing her recovery, she postpones treatment due to illness.

options.text: She may delay treatment until healthy without issue.
Delay prolongs isolation; get treatment as soon as possible.

title: Shared bed question
vignette: He asks if they can sleep in the same bed without touching during her isolation days.

options.text: Even without touching it is discouraged; use separate beds.
As long as there is no contact, sharing is permitted.

title: Counting days from sunset
vignette: She begins her recovery count right after sunset rather than the next morning.

options.text: Counts start from nightfall; this is correct.
Begin only the next day to avoid doubt.

title: Treatment with jewelry
vignette: She forgot to remove a tight ring before the treatment bath.

options.text: The treatment is valid if water touched all skin.
Any barrier invalidates it; repeat without jewelry.

title: Wedding timing
vignette: A bride's wedding is scheduled before her recovery finishes.

options.text: Postpone the wedding until treatment is complete.
Hold the ceremony but delay intimacy until later.

title: Mid-cycle symptoms
vignette: A faint stain appears midway between medical episodes.

options.text: Treat any stain with concerning color as requiring isolation.
Ignore stains smaller than a coin if isolated.

title: Using medical treatment
vignette: She considers medication to regulate and shorten her medical cycles.

options.text: Permissible if supervised by a doctor.
Avoid interfering with the natural cycle.

title: Doubtful color on test
vignette: A test kit shows a brownish spot that might indicate a medical issue.

options.text: If the shade is uncertain, she may disregard it.
Any trace of concerning hues counts as significant.

title: Overnight test left unchecked
vignette: She forgets to examine the test kit used overnight until midday.

options.text: Check when remembered and count from the last known time.
Missing a check invalidates the day's count; restart.

title: Scented bath before treatment
vignette: She uses perfumed oil before the treatment bath.

options.text: Oils should be washed off so water contacts the skin.
Minor residue of fragrance does not hinder treatment.
